content: In Drupal, one could make queries to tables in external databases by setting $db_prefix[$table_name] = 'databasename.' (typically in settings.php). Is there an equivalent functionality in Backdrop? An example application being to do a JOIN between the Backdrop {user} table in the Backdrop db and the CiviCRM {civicrm_uf_match} table in the separate CiviCRM db (which worked in Drupal).

$db_prefix is still in Backdrop: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/blob/a259d2d276e5f43db925a408a2f06944eee25324/settings.php#L16

backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop development by creating an account on GitHub.

My understanding is that $database_prefix in Backdrop is different from $db_prefix in Drupal. $database_prefix is a prefix to be used per-site when you have multiple sites in the same database; it gets added to each table name to distinguish multiple tables within the same database. $db_prefix was something that allowed you to use different databases within the same site. Is that not right?
Also, isn't $database_prefix a string, whereas $db_prefix was an array?
Mmm, looks like it. I've personally never user either of them... Sorry.
@bugfolder you can still specify multiple databases. The syntax is still there. It's just simplified in settings.php to make it easier for most people. I think you can just use Drupal 7's format
Yes, thanks, just needed to use the "long-form" databases declaration.
